intro: Maba pervilleana, commonly known as the Malayan maba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature. The plant has been used traditionally in local medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
